page.title: 13Tourism-Beamish
page.content: {Home Farm { { }Home Farm is another of the 'working' features of Beamish Museum.The farm has a full range of buildings in which various activities can be seen. Exhibitions in the farm include the display concerning northern breeds of farm animals-cattle and sheep in particular,farm machinery and the life of the farmer.Among the animals kept on the farm there are pigs, goats, sheep,horses and cows.Bees are also kept to provide honey for sale in the farm shop. One of the most popular 'exhibits' is the village blacksmith who can be seen working in the smithy on most days in the museum.
